html: Parallelism of the “thunderous voice ”—the king of Assyria/Babylon—and “your uprising” demonstrates the inseparable connection between the archtyrant’s destroying the world’s wicked inhabitants and Jehovah’s coming out in judgment against them (Isaiah 2:19, 21; 3:13; 13:2, 4-5; 14:22; 28:21; 31:2 ). In either case, the peoples or nations flee and scatter, leaving their wealth behind as spoil for the archtyrant and his alliance (Isaiah 10:5-6; 13:16; 42:22, 24 ). Resembling voracious caterpillars and swarms of locusts, the enemies of Jehovah’s people defraud all who belong to Isaiah’s Babylon category.
